document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

D4DF1C7BC711478EAEE467E649944EA2.description:
Design a bioremediation project
including plans to evaluate the effectiveness
of the effort.

8EE5D64BC82F419C91DA51BCDFA911CC.description:
Analyze and summarize the
risks and benefits of using biotechnology for
bioremediation.

ED83B22BCD59492BB7E809CC95B924B7.description:
Provide examples of instances
in which bioremediation can be applied to
clean up environmental contaminants.

89D153A6606C47FABE12C304F9424733.description:
Monitor and review the
treatment of industrial chemical wastes with
microorganisms.

8AD8F4FAB2394362A43E8D81E8673991.description:
Evaluate and describe the
processes involved in biotreatment of industrial
chemical wastes.

62D18D570EB94F2C97406ADB21C6E0DD.description:
Analyze the role of microorganisms
in industrial chemical waste treatment.

AE5BDD7ED24E4BB48BA459EB464C43B7.description:
Monitor and evaluate the
treatment of biological wastes with microorganisms.

4F1B1CD7658D47298A0F64D6BD87CD75.description:
Assess and describe the processes
involved in biotreatment of biological
wastes.

6BADDB3DFBDF4D41BBFB35AB9AB1C2B2.description:
Summarize the purpose of
microorganisms in biological waste management.

94802A7721534903BEBB9F2E365B3E77.description:
Conduct studies to evaluate
the treatment of a waste product using a
genetically engineered organism.

C556576FC330441B9306EA43E512E34B.description:
Analyze the process by which
organisms are genetically engineered for
waste treatment.

6140232DE1034279BE7F62EFB50147F7.description:
Compare and contrast the use
of natural organisms and genetically-engineered
organisms in the treatment of wastes.

C9BF1C41E0954A198C305365854939B4.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to improve waste
management (e.g., genetically modified organisms, bioremediation, etc.).

5908DD3D01C54B2B9DF9BAD2C9310D75.description:
Produce methane and
co-products from biomass.

8CFC437A3665499EBC3754B19C6A1480.description:
Analyze and describe the process
used to produce methane from biomass.

8B271642FE7E47868F8AC56F70A09060.description:
Produce biodiesel and
co-products from biomass.

83B8BC39BC414F7B8B5B7FEAA3DC96A7.description:
Produce biodiesel and
co-products from biomass.

9F285053EBC54A9A9EAD0732ACE32AFF.description:
Analyze and document the
process used to produce biodiesel from biomass.

EC8278B7408549D3B1CAF14B5D07E1D8.description:
Define and summarize the
process of transesterification and its potential
applications.

61F4F8EAFB664AD3A2653BC3E47F21D2.description:
Produce alcohol and co-products
from biomass.

7F4940DF789B40CA9C3161C3FEFED670.description:
Correlate the relationship
between fermentation and the process used
to produce alcohol from biomass.

74F013CD40094F8DA0C49784D4C394D2.description:
Research and explain the
process of fermentation and its potential
applications

D1991069BDED4F35B84D2F1FAD7614D7.description:
Conduct a review of the
technologies used to create biofuels from
biomass and weigh the pros and cons of each
method.

798B626391294BBDBA2F8AF6C630FCBD.description:
Assess the characteristics
of biomass that make it useful for biofuels
production.

E4BA25E6849E416EBE8AC8877E88BDEE.description:
Differentiate between biomass
and sources of biomass.

8601772927574EF9A99E204A37A298F3.description:
Evaluate and support how biofuels
could solve a global issue (e.g., environmental,
agricultural, etc.).

E41A76D8379A4400BC530308FD8B09A9.description:
Analyze the impact of the
production and use of biofuels on the environment.

523551F2E88C496C8CFB8B0CD124D607.description:
Examine and synthesize the
need for biofuels (e.g., cellulosic bioenergy,
etc.).

4CC824DBA9CE4362AF7D2AF5C06D4634.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to produce biofuels (e.g.,
fermentation, transesterification, methanogenesis, etc.).

7D8F1A9D55314B98BFA7EAD6CFA1CA75.description:
Select and utilize techniques
to measure biodiversity in a population.

9D59DA30E2444453BC6298566E56AC9E.description:
Assess whether current
threats to biodiversity will have an unsustainable
impact on human populations.

ACF6D6A625254431BE7A53182F313396.description:
Summarize the need for global
biodiversity and applications of biotechnology
to reduce threats to biodiversity.

7181939F1C554C5AA24E3CF067F9CDF8.description:
Evaluate the process used to
produce pharmaceuticals from transgenic
organisms (e.g., hormones for animals, etc.).

0656A4194B394F59A4EE64B9BCBFE3EF.description:
Distinguish the difference
between plant-based and animal-based
pharmaceuticals and describe their role in
agriculture.

24F7B059A70848C781E5739D381D76EC.description:
Research and categorize the
types of pharmaceuticals developed for animals
and humans through biotechnology.

A8EF899E958040CC83952D86EB125EE7.description:
Design animal-care protocols
to ethically monitor and promote animal systems
associated with biotechnology.

A4B5322D24304F6DA883907E3E806DB3.description:
Assess the benefits, risks and
opportunities associated with using biotechnology
to promote animal health.

67691A6D064C4338A8D9BECAB486E0BB.description:
Examine and classify biotechnology
processes applicable to animal health
(e.g., genetic testing, etc.).

E8BC7FE9F7F94B9B8657F6B8D6473853.description:
Perform plant-breeding techniques
(e.g., plant tissue culture, etc.).

67C7D267BAC245A49C6216804C1CCEA2.description:
Choose techniques and identify
tools used to monitor and direct plant
breeding.

6B8A42A6926448C7B7EEED538696CBB5.description:
Research and describe the
aims and techniques involved in selective
plant-breeding process.

FE1BD97159874A7EB9163F4D6791D033.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to enhance plant and
animal care and production (e.g., selective breeding, pharmaceuticals, biodiversity, etc.).

64BD1D486DF940BBB565B6589CF44A24.description:
Propose opportunities to use
bioprospecting after weighing the short-term
and long-term impacts on the environment.

EDC92402E47641E0A74889F45DC5D78F.description:
Assess and document the
pros and cons of bioprospecting to achieve a
research or product development objective.

DE29541986AD4868B52AA2BC1D04DF7D.description:
Research and summarize the
potential applications of bioprospecting in
biotechnology and agriculture.

8592D2A19D9D4DF2925C6057E054BBA3.description: Monitor and evaluate processes used in the synthesis of a molecule.

2649DB63C540409194FA2B3E67846D1F.description: Apply the processes used in the production of molecules for use in industrial applications.

2E59181C3DBC43D98A48D0B86E1098D6.description:
Define and summarize industrial
biotechnology and categorize the
benefits and risks associated with its use in
manufacturing (e.g., fabrics, plastics, etc.).

34189F354A6D40FBA0216B06A1430606.description:
Evaluate the impact of modified
organisms on the natural environment.

2D9D666BFD6F41F6883F30EE413A14DF.description:
Analyze how biotechnology
can be used to monitor the effects of agricultural
practices on natural populations.

E6A357982D474D9DAA5A59D91B8212F6.description:
Examine the consequences of
agricultural practices on natural populations.

F77F943735524A2BB8D1B0EAA6AB60A5.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to protect the
environment and maximize use of natural resources (e.g., biomass, bioprospecting, industrial
biotechnology, etc.).

052AC75CA05249BD839813ACA8109DCE.description:
Process food using biotechnology
to achieve an intended purpose (e.g.,
preservation, flavor enhancement, etc.).

0E11FC43DF1D49E49178D30E0435DA93.description:
Compare and contrast the effectiveness,
purpose, and outcomes associated
with biotechnology as well as conventional
processes used in food processing.

BD01D8DA58D7428A8880C967EF7E699D.description:
Identify and categorize foods
produced through the use of biotechnology
(e.g., fermentation, etc.) to change the chemical
properties of food for an intended purpose
(e.g., create desirable nutritional profile,
preservation, flavor, etc.)

D9AA518241EA4B8C9B5D224C146B3946.description:
Conduct studies using scientific
techniques to improve or discover enzymes
for use in biotechnology (e.g., microbial
strain selection).

DC59977AE7BA49F4BBB313D0A960F2A9.description:
Analyze processes by which
enzymes are produced through biotechnology.

6510CD98AB5F418684ACA59954F64AFB.description:
Examine enzymes, the changes
they cause and the physical and chemical
parameters that affect enzymatic reactions
(e.g., food, cellulosic bioenergy, etc.).

E9EC16E9B09C49D2A75589A7C05643DB.description:
Design and perform an assay
to detect a target microorganism in food,
water or the environment

CAE7C6718E904CD2BD69243FCAEE6509.description:
Assess and describe the use
of biotechnology to detect microbes.

B53F68CFC3E84BB2826BFCC1370102D2.description:
Summarize reasons for detecting
microbes and identify sources of
microbes.

6225E9CEE65A48AB94D6C14B3F741F87.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to enhance the
production of food through the use of microorganisms and enzymes.

28418A6DD653492E8540C7232500AD98.description:
Conduct studies to track the
movement of transgenes in the environment.

C73F0A240DE94AE2BEC472EE8555B95F.description:
Analyze data to identify
changes and patterns of transgenic species in
the environment.

6B9F26B21A1042D4AD2F5D722B506687.description:
Define and summarize epigenetics
and synthesize the relationship
between mutation, migration and evolution of
transgenes in the environment.

58B372061B674B1F9711F2A04420EC0D.description:
Conduct field or clinical trials
for genetically modified species.

C6813BCFB4E8453DB96F5539F8813A38.description:
Research and evaluate genetic
engineering procedures used in the production
of living species.

AA67D41CD3DC4957A88308891B1306BE.description:
Analyze the benefits and risks
associated with the use of biotechnology to
increase productivity and improve quality of
living species (e.g., plants, animals such as
aquatic species, etc.).

7BA19EB99BDF4F26B29C21E790A595EF.description:
Transform plant or animal cells
by performing a cellular transformation.

E16FB02FA1174E7BB888B72A4499641A.description:
Assess and argue the pros and
cons of transgenic species in agriculture.

0E18BE208231470296EE33936A6B274D.description:
Summarize the process of
transformation of eukaryotic cells with transgenic
DNA.

174C862D0A8C49E89A35934EC5A20C7C.description:
Design and conduct experiments
to evaluate an existing transgenic
eukaryote.

78A409B426654083B4CC2E16747B3D33.description:
Analyze and document the
processes and describe the techniques used
to produce transgenic eukaryotes (e.g.,
microbial synthetic biology, gene knockout
therapy, traditional gene insertion, etc.).

1635B1CD0A6F4E9496892239BFCFA2D0.description:
Summarize biological, social,
agronomic and economic reasons for genetic
modification of eukaryotes.

7808B39937C745EB9FA26F9EF6D699F2.description:
Apply biotechnology principles, techniques and processes to create transgenic
species through genetic engineering.

D5B74455821C4211A744698C474DFB87.description:
NCAE Standard: Demonstrate the application of biotechnology to solve
problems in Agriculture, Food and Natural Resources (AFNR) systems (e.g.,
bioengineering, food processing, waste management, horticulture, forestry,
livestock, crops, etc.).

F1DEF1AEBE814F0F8FB10C1732B1359F.description:
Use antibodies to detect and
quantify antigens by conducting an Enzyme-Linked
Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA).

DAA5645621FF4CE1B10A20D2D759542D.description:
Analyze and document how
antibodies are formed and describe how they
can be used in agricultural biotechnology.

ADDE1FDF1F0E4C3E9F40ED68DE692DC0.description:
Synthesize the relationship
between proteins, enzymes and antibodies.

A6FE826547584117BDB184F6F9FBF9FF.description:
Evaluate the biochemical
properties of proteins to explain their function
and predict potential uses.

37CD505565ED4AD0A5B0D0B1E7154297.description:
Demonstrate protein separation
techniques and interpret the results.

ED32AABCC4C34B07B43ACC5DCB5A2E75.description:
Examine and document the
role and applications of proteins in agricultural
biotechnology.

E4F7A78854C94C2DB35688D2184066FF.description:
Manipulate and analyze DNA
and RNA through advanced scientific procedures
(e.g., southern blotting, cloning, PCR,
RT-PCR, etc.).

8A2B7ED620E04994800CD5B38660C9EB.description:
Perform electrophoretic techniques
and interpret electrophoresis fragmentation
patterns (e.g., gel electrophoresis,
southern blotting, etc.).

3FD1C4054DF34D229DAD8E03A00ECD19.description:
Extract and purify DNA and
RNA according to standard operating procedures.

E4A909F1B54D480EB09C6FA99027E0F0.description:
Evaluate factors that influence
gene expression

2A2B24153A6647BF84FBBDEB95A27C3F.description:
Analyze and interpret the
molecular basis for heredity and the tools and
techniques used in DNA and RNA manipulations.

CA8D0E592EB44DBAAE9C3708197814F3.description:
Compare and contrast the
structures of DNA and RNA and investigate
how genotype influences phenotype.

8AE14A38A643474CA50057558ABB0EE4.description:
Isolate, maintain, quantify and
store cell cultures according to standard operating
procedures.

ABB9461C7735408586B31575F5C2CB4A.description:
Characterize the physical and
biological properties of organisms.

133E0F51F90E4A0DBDB6ADD47EC5FBFC.description:
Differentiate types of organisms
and demonstrate safe handling to
maintain organism purity and personal safety
(e.g., plant and animal tissue, cell cultures,
microbes, etc.).

3810AB4908FF49E389D35DEF48D01C3A.description:
Examine and perform scientific procedures using microbes, DNA, RNA and proteins
in a laboratory.

6AD1E89E87B44D3E8F569854A6BA6A6B.description:
Propose a management plan
to reduce laboratory waste and prevent ecological
or health problems related to waste
disposal.

69312F4AFDF24A92820C58A92A99A6D6.description:
Perform waste disposal
according to the standard operating procedures.

A34B21ADA5564E3FBC5F43D47C5B7E9C.description:
Summarize what happens
to waste after it leaves the laboratory and
identify opportunities to reduce waste and
unnecessary costs.

E2D939FDA9F64AAAA6D2E34E5120C9B3.description:
Create a plan for stocking and
maintaining supplies of biological and chemical
materials in a laboratory.

507DFC767BDF405BACA40FDE36114EB5.description:
Inventory biological and
chemical materials and maintain accurate
records of supplies and expiration dates.

2785DFF8135740229818B5ADDA4B24C9.description:
Classify and describe hazards
associated with biological and chemical
materials.

1007C4CC226A4B26AB9F42AD4F541E40.description:
Evaluate the benefits and limitations
of personal protective equipment.

74980C78F0E9426BB6616F606F5E37F9.description:
Assess the need for personal
protective equipment in a variety of situations
and select the appropriate equipment
to wear when working with biological and
chemical materials.

1FB3D94204F54663B4D590AEBDD59DDA.description:
Classify different types of personal
protective equipment and demonstrate
how to properly utilize the equipment.

CB30815D6F824CA3A7A7785A93B3C678.description:
Safely manage and dispose of biological materials, chemicals and wastes according
to standard operating procedures.

34007D5F745D465F854004662A9E092D.description:
Verify the physical properties
of solutions (e.g., molarity, percent mass/volume,
dilutions, etc.).

F5C01FEBD1BF4D7FA79B2C9F5F604E44.description:
Formulate and prepare solutions
using standard operating procedures
(e.g., proper labeling, storage, etc.).

44E5C59016D74FFF835A788089F7F104.description:
Categorize and label the
types of solutions that are commonly prepared
in a laboratory (e.g., buffers, reagents,
media, etc.).

403A0ADEDE8C4A4294CB86C8CF89F243.description:
Create a standard operating
procedure for a biological process.

5567EDF6634842249666DDFF66AF4D90.description:
Analyze and select an appropriate
standard operating procedure for
working with biological materials based upon
their classification.

AF584B9E2EB04669824CFF075086114D.description:
Examine and implement
standard operating procedures for the use of
biological materials according to directions
and their classification (e.g., proper handling
of bacteria or DNA before, during and after
use).

8C2C8477B3864F6F98B3085E798D7B78.description:
Conduct assays and experiments
under aseptic conditions.

B8539C6C90404056866CE7EE0659F8DB.description:
Demonstrate advanced aseptic
techniques in the laboratory (e.g., sterile
work area, sterile handling, personal hygiene,
etc.).

46A21061E89146F683B3772FFB994EB1.description:
Classify and document basic
aseptic techniques in the laboratory

D082B61455704FAFB4B2D544B8FB8EBD.description:
Apply standard operating procedures for the safe handling of biological and
chemical materials in a laboratory.

7183465404EC44FE88824CE0DF12A201.description:
Perform sterilization techniques
for equipment in a laboratory using
standard operating procedures.

5ABB7C0C8412418EBB65E02DED84E836.description:
Create a plan for sterilizing
equipment in a laboratory according to standard
operating procedures.

DC25AE6336B04F86845B7A66501533D2.description:
Differentiate between sterilization
techniques for equipment in a laboratory
(e.g., media bottles vs. laminar flow
hood, etc.).

BA508E9938BD41D69FF3091CB4E71ACD.description:
Operate advanced laboratory
equipment and measurement devices (e.g.,
thermal cycler, imaging system, etc.).

BC474DE48142489D9483B66FFF206C76.description:
Manipulate basic laboratory
equipment and measurement devices (e.g.,
water bath, electrophoresis equipment, micropipettes,
laminar flow hood, etc.).

45C0F1E7CDDE49AEBEEDE5DE53A26A14.description:
Categorize and identify laboratory
equipment according to its purpose in
scientific research.

DB8647B072A8423EA4F9623528434246.description:
Perform ongoing maintenance
of laboratory equipment according to the
standard operating procedures (e.g., calibration,
testing, etc.).

9023242E29AB4B6FA758F4CA1DF46FF1.description:
Develop a maintenance program
for laboratory equipment based upon
the standard operating procedures.

DDE99C32C8424035B289B6804244A7AB.description:
Identify, interpret, and implement
standard operating procedures for laboratory
equipment.

2202159B48A140B58B25EE15F938D3E4.description:
Implement standard operating procedures for the proper maintenance, use and
sterilization of equipment in a laboratory.

C11A835E2E6E4E31989E96E98BF241A0.description:
Critique an application of
bioinformatics to solve an agricultural issue
and recommend procedures for keeping the
information safe.

0A38C976269640889DED4D3348E3F84C.description:
Analyze and document the
security procedures for data collected using
bioinformatics.

0E4A222AE3FA4216BE9DF1DAD88C95FE.description:
Evaluate the role of bioinformatics
in agriculture and summarize the
types of databases that are available (e.g.,
genomic, transcriptomics, etc.).

0604C2C86F8142B2ADB20DD7B3FB4FF3.description:
Devise a strategy for ensuring
the security of data and information collected
in a laboratory.

521AE6CE5DE14D2A856506F9F2343AE3.description:
Assess when security procedures
for data and information collected in a
laboratory should be implemented.

829A451EDA454E72908AF2B4755C31BE.description:
Research and summarize the
need for data and information security in a
laboratory and demonstrate best practices.

4E968101092E4A77B0CD4905AAFAD41D.description:
Evaluate the strengths and
weaknesses of using research documentation
and propose improvements to ensure study
reproduction and utility in future studies.

479ACBBF98FC424D979C2326E7CCA3DA.description:
Maintain and interpret laboratory
records documented in a laboratory
to ensure data accuracy and integrity (e.g.,
avoid bias, record any conflicts of interest,
avoid misinterpreted results, etc.).

9565865C85C04C37BBAA87F6FE03D011.description:
Compare and contrast common
record-keeping methods used in a
laboratory (e.g., paper notebook, electronic
notebook, etc.).

00A1424B441242869E3C064FB572F54D.description:
Read, document, evaluate and secure accurate laboratory records of experimental
protocols, observations and results.

E02FCB272708415AB33AEC5D9F3596A1.description:
NCAE Standard: Demonstrate proficiency by safely applying appropriate
laboratory skills to complete tasks in a biotechnology research and development
environment (e.g., standard operating procedures, record keeping, aseptic
technique, equipment maintenance, etc.).

8F2C8089A89440A880CCF2941478EBC7.description:
Design studies to examine
public perceptions of scientifically-based
arguments regarding biotechnology in agriculture
and reflect on the reasons why the
public may support or resist significant breakthroughs
using biotechnology.

C5B236E9C45F4D8CADAE3A9340503CF1.description:
Analyze the impact of public
perceptions on the application of biotechnology
in different AFNR systems.

86ABAAB1E3F543919DFAB3CD13C97A12.description:
Research and summarize public
perceptions of biotechnology in agriculture
(e.g., social and cultural issues).

FA587629AA4343A9B1952D52F6F1BDC9.description:
Propose a solution for a legal
issue associated with biotechnology in agriculture.

670128C036D34F43B357FCBA4DADF3CB.description:
Determine the significance
and impacts of legal issues related to biotechnology
in agriculture.

38DEEA2D86804D35840E6E13FC571829.description:
Research and summarize legal
issues related to biotechnology in agriculture
(e.g., protection of intellectual property
through patents, copyright, trademarks, etc.).

61A5B9C4FE6948B4AEB9472177BDFCF9.description:
Devise and support an argument
for or against an ethical issue associated
with biotechnology in agriculture.

3E8FD97876714359A6794136E9569A6A.description:
Analyze the implications bioethics
may have on future advancements in
AFNR.

0223DDDE33094A6C98C8057398117199.description:
Research and summarize the
emergence, evolution and implications of
bioethics associated with biotechnology in
agriculture.

D75A7E981F0B4EDAB916F5FEDC21C2AE.description:
Analyze the relationship and implications of bioethics, laws and public perceptions
on applications of biotechnology in agriculture (e.g., ethical, legal, social, cultural issues).

A7E01EED22B94B1EBE03F444BAEE578E.description:
Evaluate data to determine if
new technologies present a major regulatory
issue to health, safety and/or the environment.

977A028ACA4244A594AF8ED3BE6C0C5C.description:
Research and summarize factors
and data that regulatory agencies use to
evaluate the potential risks a new application
of biotechnology may pose to health, safety
and the environment.

B6310ADFC6804938A6C388353B35158A.description:
Explain the relationship between
regulatory agencies and the protection
of public interests such as health, safety and
the environment.

7062D3B1954149A29D58AAC200370DBF.description:
Critique and propose a solution
for a major regulatory issue pertaining to
biotechnology in agriculture.

6E1138501572445A8AA91EBAFE6A1DFE.description:
Analyze the impact major
regulatory issues have on public acceptance
of biotechnology in agriculture.

880F04A63C7C485E8C18AD32B79B297A.description:
Research and document major
regulatory issues related to biotechnology in
agriculture.

872D06C021054400AC0045758927E106.description:
Explain and critique a decision
made by a major agency that regulates agricultural
biotechnology.

E2191F276B184D6782BE69815123D2B3.description:
Assess and summarize the
role and scope of agencies that regulate biotechnology.

848349D262E44945A21234E0FB5F8745.description:
Compare and contrast differences
between regulatory systems worldwide.

65A4890A319E4278AE9BF1E1EF05D537.description:
Evaluate the scope and implications of regulatory agencies on applications
of biotechnology in agriculture and protection of public interests (e.g., health, safety,
environmental issues, etc.).

C3797066A0634350BDC39065F7182E7E.description:
Evaluate the short-term and
long-term benefits and risks of applying biotechnology
to agriculture.

AC7CB606866D4DFAA1FAD813E5907298.description:
Assess the benefits and risks
associated with using biotechnology to improve
agriculture.

A5F76227C2BF4E919A1E07BC3EE15035.description:
Compare and contrast the
benefits and risks of biotechnology compared
with alternative approaches to improving
agriculture.

1565937C4E744563A8B2060CD55945D5.description:
Design a potential application
of biotechnology to meet emerging agricultural
and societal needs.

A765422EDA2B4BA38EAAAA4A88C11881.description:
Analyze and document emerging
problems and issues associated with
agricultural biotechnology.

40F270675E6B4DCCAB1EFA98174594EE.description:
Distinguish between current
and emerging applications of biotechnology
in agriculture.

EBAF9045EAA24D3ABDF0690239546FF4.description:
Evaluate the outcomes and impacts
of biotechnology on the globalization
of agriculture.

B4819FC8815E472AA9C423BAC3DE34F1.description:
Assess and summarize current
work in biotechnology being done to add
value to agricultural and society.

4D228F9C646E48FD8EB18DB4F93C8293.description:
Examine and categorize
current applications and gains achieved in applying
biotechnology to agriculture

scientists use the scientific method to build
upon previous findings in current and emerging
research.

progression of biotechnology and the evolution

applications of biotechnology in agriculture (e.g., major innovators, historical developments,
potential applications of biotechnology, etc.).
